title: 109_hr2356
content: The Act titled "Preserving Patient Access to Physicians Act of 2005" aims to reform the Medicare physician payment update system by eliminating the Sustainable Growth Rate (SGR) payment update system. The "Preserving Patient Access to Physicians Act of 2005" reforms the Medicare physician payment update system by eliminating the Sustainable Growth Rate (SGR) system and implementing updates to the single conversion factor for 2006 and beyond. The update for 2006 must be at least 2.7 percent, and for years starting in 2007, the update is based on the percentage change in the input price index. The Secretary establishes an input price index reflecting weighted-average input prices for physicians' services, based on the mix of goods and services in the Medicare economic index. The Secretary establishes an input price index for physicians' services based on weighted-average input prices, excluding changes in costs from factors like productivity. An annual estimate of the index change is made, along with a productivity adjustment factor published before each year. The productivity adjustment factor is determined by the Secretary based on growth in multifactor productivity in the national economy, considering both labor and nonlabor factors. This adjustment is calculated using a multi-year moving average of productivity data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Amendments are made to Section 1848 of the Act to adjust payment updates for physicians' services before 2001. The productivity adjustment factor for payment updates for physicians' services is determined by the Secretary based on growth in multifactor productivity in the national economy. The calculation involves a multi-year moving average of productivity data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Amendments are made to Section 1848 of the Act to adjust payment updates for physicians' services before 2001, with specific multipliers for different years. The Federal Register will publish the conversion factor for physicians' services for the upcoming year, along with updates and allowed expenditures for specific years. The Federal Register will publish the conversion factor for physicians' services for upcoming years, including updates and allowed expenditures. This includes updates for 2004, 2005, 2006, and subsequent years, as well as adjustments for years before 2006 in subsection (d)(1)(E)(ii) and changes in subsection (d)(4) for 2001, 2002, and 2003. In subsection (f), adjustments are made for years before 2005 in paragraph (1)(B) and updates for physicians' services are published for 2004, 2005, and subsequent years. Amendments include changes for 2001, 2002, and 2003 in paragraphs (2) and (3), specifying the timeframes for certain provisions.
